fields.description:
The backgroundColor of the children views of a tableviewrow disappear on the touch.
In development, it becomes quite annoying, I'm also forced to use graphics for solid colors.
Here is a video of an application that I'm developing.

comments.body:
This is actually a native behavior by Apple that makes all sub-views of a table-row (aka UITableViewCell) to have an alpha-channel of 0. I ran into it in the past as well (both native and Titanium) and I worked around it by making an image out of the view (using {{toImage()}} in Titanium). Again, please note that this happens on both native and Titanium platforms. 

See this link for more details and discussions: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6745919/uitableviewcell-subview-disappears-when-cell-is-selected
Closing as "not our bug". If you disagree, please reopen.
